Alternatively, you may visit any Service SG Centres and Service SG officers would be able to help you make your online nomination. Otherwise, you can also visit our CPF Service Centres to make a nomination.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why do I need to update the CPFV app?
Knowledge Article: Answer: We have upgraded the CPFV app and volunteers can expect exciting new features. Updating the app will ensure that you stay on top of app updates so that you have the best possible experience with the app. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we strive to improve your volunteering journey.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am suffering from a terminal illness or have a total permanent disability. How do I claim insurance benefits under the Home Protection Scheme? Can I claim my Dependants' Protection Scheme benefits and withdraw my CPF savings at the same time?
Knowledge Article: Answer: For member's convenience, CPF Board has developed a one-stop application form for you to apply for Home Protection Scheme (HPS) and Dependants' Protection Scheme (DPS) benefits and withdraw your CPF savings, if applicable.   To do so, you will need to: Submit an online application after logging in via Singpass. The application form will allow you to concurrently apply for both DPS benefits and withdraw of your CPF savings if applicable. Download the medical certification form that is provided upon submission of the online application and have it completed by an accredited doctor . The medical institution will need to submit the completed medical certification to CPF Board within 90 days of your application. Otherwise, your application will be cancelled. If you are claiming HPS benefits, you are required to inform your employer to submit your employment information to CPF Board for claim assessment purpose. A FormSG link will be provided to you upon submission of the online application for your employer to complete. Corppass login is required. After CPF Board receives the completed medical certification and employment information (for HPS claim, if required), you will receive an email or SMS notifying you that the application is in progress. CPF Board will notify you on the outcome of your withdrawal application and HPS claim while Great Eastern Life will notify you separately on your DPS claim outcome.   If the medical certification is to be completed by a doctor from an overseas medical institution, please write to us for assistance.   If you are mailing your documents from overseas, all documents (except for original documents) must be witnessed/certified true by an official of a Singapore Overseas Mission with his official seal/stamp duly affixed.   Alternatively, if you are residing in a country which is part of the  Apostille Convention : Your documents must first be witnessed and certified true by a Notary Public Thereafter, the notarised documents must be certified by the designated Competent Authority of your country via the issuance of an apostille certificate.

Knowledge Article: Question: How was I identified to pay my family member's MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You had previously used your MediSave to help pay the insured’s medical expenses or health insurance premiums. To encourage family responsibility, we will notify family members that they can use their MediSave to help their family member with insufficient MediSave. This makes it convenient for the majority of members who wish to help their family members pay their MediShield Life premiums. To date, more than 90% of family members approached have accepted the arrangement.   Family members who are identified as potential payers will be notified one month before premium deduction takes place. You may reject this payment arrangement by submitting Stop Payment for MediShield Life  or call us at 1800-222-3399.   You can later decide to pay for your family member's MediShield Life premiums by submitting a  Change Payer for MediShield Life.

Knowledge Article: Question: What should I do if I face difficulty logging into CPF Mobile?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Here are some ways for you to troubleshoot when encountering login issues: Check your internet connection to ensure it is stable. Relaunch CPF Mobile and try to log in again. Make sure your device operating system and CPF Mobile are updated to the latest version. The latest version of CPF Mobile is available on both the Apple App Store and Google Play Store . Check that your device date-time setting is set to “Automatic”. Ensure that you did not block all cookies in your browser settings. Set one of Singpass’ recommended browsers (Safari or Chrome) as your default browser. If you are using Firefox browser, check that you have enabled the opening of links in app in your browser settings. If the issue persists, you can write to us for further assistance. Alternatively, you may wish to check if this issue occurs for other Government website/apps, and contact Singpass Helpdesk directly to resolve any Singpass login issue.   In the meantime, you can still access our full suite of services through my cpf digital services on the CPF website, which is designed for seamless usage on mobile devices.

Knowledge Article: Question: Should I disclose my personal details to a CPF volunteer?
Knowledge Article: Answer: No. Our volunteers will never ask for your personal details such as NRIC, phone number and email address. If you have account-specific queries, they are best addressed by our trained staff via our various  customer service channels .   If you encounter such a situation, it is important that you  report so that appropriate action can be taken.

Knowledge Article: Question: What is "Activities"?
Knowledge Article: Answer: "Activities" informs you of the latest status of all your online transactions with the Board. At one glance, you will be able to tell whether your application is received, being processed, rejected or approved.   Please login to Activities with your Singpass Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) to access the service.

Knowledge Article: Question: What should I do if I can't connect to the CPFV app?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can try the following methods:   Check that your internet connection is stable Relaunch the CPFV app and try to login again Make sure your device operating system and CPFV app are updated to the latest version Restart your mobile device Delete and reinstall the CPFV app

Knowledge Article: Question: I am the appointed deputy/donee for my next of kin. How can I receive monthly payouts on behalf of my next of kin?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you are the appointed deputy or donee, you may request to receive your next of kin’s monthly payouts on his behalf.   You can make an appointment to visit any of our CPF Service Centres and bring along the following original documents:   A Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or Order of Court; A medical report from an accredited doctor stating that the member lacks mental capacity permanently; Your NRIC/Foreign Passport; and Trust bank account passbook/statement. Please ensure that you have all the necessary documents so that you can receive your loved one’s payouts smoothly.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why am I receiving SMSes from the CPF Board with the sender ID 'gov.sg'?
Knowledge Article: Answer: The Singapore Government has launched a new security measure – ‘gov.sg’, a single SMS Sender ID to be used across Government agencies. This is to help the public identify authentic Government communications sent by SMSes, and safeguard themselves against Government Official Impersonation Scams. The ‘gov.sg’ SMS Sender ID will be used by all Government agencies from 1 July 2024.

Knowledge Article: Question: Who is eligible for the CPF Retirement Planning Service and how do I make an appointment?
Knowledge Article: Answer: CPF members who are reaching 55, as well as members approaching their payout eligibility age (currently age 65), can make an appointment via cpf.gov.sg/CRPSAppt to attend the CPF Retirement Planning Service .

Knowledge Article: Question: Who is eligible for the CPF Retirement Planning Service and how do I make an appointment?
Knowledge Article: Answer: CPF members who are reaching 55, as well as members approaching their payout eligibility age (currently age 65), can make an appointment via cpf.gov.sg/CRPSAppt to attend the CPF Retirement Planning Service .

Knowledge Article: Question: What is the CPF Retirement Planning Service about?
Knowledge Article: Answer: The CPF Retirement Planning Service (CRPS) is part of the Board’s efforts to help CPF members understand our policies and enable them to make informed decisions about their CPF savings in retirement.   Find out if you are eligible and how you can make an appointment .

Knowledge Article: Question: What is the CPF Retirement Planning Service about?
Knowledge Article: Answer: The CPF Retirement Planning Service (CRPS) is part of the Board’s efforts to help CPF members understand our policies and enable them to make informed decisions about their CPF savings in retirement.   Find out if you are eligible and how you can make an appointment .

Knowledge Article: Question: What should I do if I fall prey to a malware/phishing scam?
Knowledge Article: Answer: In the unfortunate event that you fall prey to a scam, we recommend taking the following actions immediately:   Alert your bank to freeze the affected bank account. Reset your Singpass password if you think your Singpass has been compromised. For further assistance, please contact the official Singpass 24/7 helpdesk at 6335 3533. If you are 55 and above, activate the CPF Withdrawal Lock under Account settings to disable online CPF withdrawals instantly. File a police report and provide all details.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am unsure whether to start my monthly payouts now. How can I find out how much monthly payouts I can receive?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may use the Plan my monthly payouts service to find out more about your monthly payout details, provide your payout instructions and confirm your bank account details.   The Plan my monthly payouts service is available to you three months before you reach 65.   With this service, you can find out your estimated monthly payouts when you: start at 65 or defer to a later age join CPF LIFE and/or use more of your CPF savings to increase your monthly payouts.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am reaching age 65 and received an email message from CPFB on my monthly payout details. How do I verify that the email is legitimate?
Knowledge Article: Answer: To verify whether the email you received from us is legitimate, please check the following:   The sender's email address is correctly spelt and ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg. You are directed only to our official CPF website (link starting with cpf.gov.sg) The content of the email: Look for any signs of phishing attempts, such as urgent language, threats, or requests for personal information. The Board will only send digital notifications to the email address registered in our records. You may verify or update your contact details in CPF Account settings with your Singpass.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am reaching 65. What are the monthly payout options that I can choose from?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You have the flexibility to start receiving your monthly payouts anytime between 65 and 70. However, if you do not submit any instructions on your payouts by the time you turn 70, your monthly payouts will automatically start on your birthday month.    In addition, you may have some CPF savings which are withdrawable for your immediate needs. Instead of withdrawing the amount in a lump sum, you can consider the following: Use the withdrawable amount (in part or in full) to increase your monthly payouts; or Retain the savings in your CPF account to earn interest, and withdraw them when the need arises. If you choose to retain your CPF savings, any additional withdrawable savings from 65 in your Retirement Account will be transferred to your Ordinary Account in the month you start your payouts, for your future withdrawal.   Eligible members can use the Plan my monthly payouts service to find out more about their monthly payout details, provide their payout instructions and confirm their bank account details.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am the appointed deputy/donee for my next of kin. How can I receive monthly payouts on behalf of my next of kin?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you are the appointed deputy or donee, you may request to receive your next of kin’s monthly payouts on his behalf.   You can make an appointment to visit any of our CPF Service Centres and bring along the following original documents:   A Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or Order of Court; A medical report from an accredited doctor stating that the member lacks mental capacity permanently; Your NRIC/Foreign Passport; and Trust bank account passbook/statement. Please ensure that you have all the necessary documents so that you can receive your loved one’s payouts smoothly.

Knowledge Article: Question: How would my CPF savings be paid to me?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You will receive your CPF savings to your bank account provided under your Account settings . If you have set your PayNow NRIC-linked bank account as your bank account, your savings will be transferred via PayNow and you will generally receive your CPF savings almost immediately upon the withdrawal application. However, please note that you won't be able to withdraw your CPF savings via PayNow if you have  unpaid taxes, MediShield Life premiums  or outstanding divorce matters .   For other bank accounts, payments will be made via GIRO generally up to five working days after date of submission.

Knowledge Article: Question: What are the new anti-scam security measures available to CPF members?
Knowledge Article: Answer: In addition to our existing safeguards such as ensuring that CPF savings are credited to bank accounts that are verified to belong to the members, Singpass Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) and enhanced authentication measures, we have also implemented a new suite of measures for our members to take fuller control of their online experience. These new measures include:   Daily Withdrawal Limit    A limit that all CPF members aged 55 and above can set to determine the maximum daily amount they want to withdraw online. The amount withdrawable by CPF members aged 55 and above remains subjected to the current withdrawal rules.   All CPF members aged 55 and above will have their online Daily Withdrawal Limit defaulted at $2,000 for a start. Members who prefer a different Daily Withdrawal Limit can adjust it up to a maximum of $200,000, at any time under Account settings . Any increase to the Daily Withdrawal Limit will be subject to enhanced authentication measures and a 12-hour cooling period to provide sufficient time for members to react in the event of unauthorised adjustments.    CPF Withdrawal Lock   CPF members who wish to disable online withdrawals or do not plan to withdraw soon can consider activating the CPF Withdrawal Lock, which instantly sets the Daily Withdrawal Limit to $0. Please refer to the  three simple steps to activate the CPF Withdrawal Lock.   To re-enable online withdrawals, members would need to increase the online Daily Withdrawal Limit under Account settings . This requires enhanced authentication and 12 hours to take effect. Online CPF withdrawals can be made after 12 hours from the time members re-adjust their Daily Withdrawal Limit upwards.   Alternatively, members can also make an appointment to withdraw in person at CPF Service Centres if they do not want to adjust their online limit. Generally, the next available appointment would be in a week’s time; subsequently, members will receive their withdrawn CPF savings in their bank account registered with us generally within five working days. To minimise any potential delay during the withdrawal process, we encourage members intending to make large withdrawals to plan in advance.   Please visit the FAQs below to find out more on the Daily Withdrawal Limit and the CPF Withdrawal Lock:   What type of CPF withdrawals does the Daily Withdrawal Limit apply to and how do I change the Daily Withdrawal Limit? What is the CPF Withdrawal Lock, and how can I activate it? Can I choose to opt-out of the Daily Withdrawal Limit? What should I do if I need to withdraw more than the maximum online Daily Withdrawal Limit? Enhanced authentication and 12-hour cooling period when updating contact details via the Update Contact Details (UCD) form      Members who are updating their contact details via the UCD e-form under Account settings will be subject to a 12-hour cooling period. Members may also be prompted to verify their identity before submitting the update form.    Enhanced authentication when updating bank account details via the ‘Update Bank Account’ e-service   Members can update their bank account details with CPF Board to receive payments such as withdrawal of CPF savings and monthly payouts via  my cpf  digital services –  Account settings  with their Singpass.   Members will be prompted to verify their identity through enhanced authentication to update their bank account details. PayNow NRIC-linked bank accounts will be activated after a 12-hour cooling period, and all other bank accounts will generally take up to two working days to be activated after your bank confirms that the account belongs to you.   Please visit the FAQs below to find out more about the new “Update Bank Account” e-service:   How do I update my bank account details with CPF Board? Why do I need to update my registered bank account with CPF Board to my PayNow NRIC-linked bank account to make PayNow withdrawals if I have already withdrawn via PayNow previously? Do I have to provide my bank account details to CPF Board if I do not have any upcoming payments from CPF Board? Which CPF payments will I receive in the bank account provided under my Account settings?

Knowledge Article: Question: How does CPF Board protect and use my personal information? Is CPF Board bound by Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)?
Knowledge Article: Answer: There are strict policies, processes, and safeguards to ensure the proper use and protection of personal data within CPF Board. While the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) does not apply to government agencies, Government's data protection standards are aligned with, if not more stringent than, the requirements of the PDPA. CPF Board also requires the same high standards in third parties’ handling of CPF data to prevent inadvertent disclosure of CPF member’s details.    CPF Board is committed in ensuring that CPF members’ data are protected, while using the data to continuously understand members’ needs to refine and develop better policies and services.    You may refer to our privacy statement for more details.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I change my bank account for GIRO instalments for my MediSave contributions?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If your bank account is with the participating banks , please complete the Set up GIRO for MediSave contributions using your Singpass. You will be re-directed to the bank's ibanking portal to complete the application. You can check the status of your online application through my cpf digital services - Activities with your Singpass.   If you would like to use an account from other banks, please download and submit the Apply for GIRO for MediSave Contributions (FORM SE GIRO) (PDF, 0.1MB) to the Board. Deduction will be made from the existing bank account until the new GIRO arrangement takes effect.

Knowledge Article: Question: Where can I find guides on how to make Contribute As You Earn (CAYE) transactions?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you need assistance on how to make Contribute As You Earn (CAYE) transactions, you can refer to the  CAYE step-by-step guide , or you can write to us .

Knowledge Article: Question: If my email service provider implements the email security measures, does it mean that I no longer have to check that the email sender domain is from a “.gov.sg” domain for emails sent by Singapore government agencies?
Knowledge Article: Answer: We recommend that you still scrutinise that the email sender domain is from a “.gov.sg” domain as scammers may attempt to send emails from lookalike domains (e.g. “-gov.sg”, “.gov-sg”) and pass the verification checks by Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant email service providers.

Knowledge Article: Question: Can I enjoy tax relief as a self-employed person when I contribute to my MediSave Account to offset my outstanding MediSave payable, pre-pay my future MediSave payable or make voluntary top-ups to my CPF accounts?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Self-employed persons (SEPs) can enjoy tax relief on their MediSave or CPF contributions based on their annual net trade income (NTI). However, there is no tax relief for your MediSave or CPF contributions if your assessed NTI for the year of assessment is zero or negative.   You can enjoy tax relief on your MediSave or CPF contributions based on whichever is lower:   37% of assessable income; or CPF Annual Limit of $37,740; or Actual amount contributed by you Please note that there will be a personal income tax relief cap of $80,000 which will apply from Year of Assessment 2018. This cap applies to the total amount of all tax reliefs claimed, including any relief on voluntary contributions made on or after 1 January 2017.   As accepted MediSave or CPF contributions cannot be refunded, you should evaluate whether you would benefit from tax relief on your voluntary CPF top-ups and make an informed decision. Please visit the  Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS)  website for more information.

Knowledge Article: Question: I know that I should not rely on the email display name which is easily spoofed. Isn't it enough to check that the email sender's domain ends with ".gov.sg"? Why do I still need to check that my email service provider implements the needed protections?
Knowledge Article: Answer: It is not sufficient to check that the email sender is from an email domain that ends with “.gov.sg” as a scammer can easily forge the email address with such an email domain to impersonate trusted senders (eg. you get an email supposedly from “customer department <customer@cpf.gov.sg>” . However, such spoofed emails can be detected by email service providers which have the security measures in place to verify if emails are from a legitimate sender (CPF Board), and reject or quarantine emails that do not pass verification checks.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is CPF Board sending emails to advise members about email spoofing?
Knowledge Article: Answer: The Board uses email as one of its channels to communicate with CPF members. While we have implemented email security measures to prevent scammers from impersonating us, these measures work only if email service providers also implement such protection at their end. We have developed a utility tool “Email receiver checker” that you can easily use to check whether your email service provider has in place the protection known as Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC).   CPF Board is sending emails to a small number of members so that they can try out the utility tool and provide feedback about it. These members are using email service providers which may not have the recommended email security in place.

Knowledge Article: Question: Where can I find CPF Board's email receiver checker utility tool?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can find CPF Board's email receiver checker utility tool (beta version) under Tools and services > Enquiry services.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I update my registered bank account details with CPF Board?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can update your registered bank account details with CPF Board to receive payments such as withdrawal of CPF savings and monthly payouts via my   cpf  digital services –  Account settings with your Singpass.   You will need to verify your identity using enhanced authentication measures to update your registered bank account details.   How to update your registered bank account details with CPF Board:   Log in to your CPF account with your Singpass. On the website menu, click on ‘Account services’ > ‘Your account information’ > ‘Update account settings’. Click the ‘Bank account’ tab and click ‘Update’. For PayNow , select ‘PayNow NRIC-linked bank account’ and submit the form. The bank account will be updated after 12 hours For Interbank GIRO , key in your bank account details and submit the form. The bank account will generally take up to two  working days to be activated after your bank confirms that the bank account belongs to you.

Knowledge Article: Question: What test results would I receive when I use CPF Board's email receiver checker utility tool?
Knowledge Article: Answer: After you use CPF Board’s email receiver checker utility tool , your test notification results would be sent to your email inbox. The utility tool will attempt to send two emails to your email address. Everyone who uses the tool would receive a first email notification. Only those whose email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant would receive a second notification. If you receive the second notification, we recommend that you switch to a DMARC-compliant email provider or request your current email provider to implement DMARC.   You can expect to receive the test notification results in your email inbox soon after you perform the test.   If you find that the results have not reached your inbox, please check your mailbox size and spam folder. It may be possible that your mailbox is full in your Inbox*, or that your email service provider has treated the test notification as spam due to certain words in the content.   *Note: For email providers which are DMARC-compliant but which enforce its own email policies that override the sender’s DMARC policies (e.g. Hotmail and Outlook), you would receive the second notification email (indicating DMARC non-compliance) in the spam/junk folder.

Knowledge Article: Question: The utility tool results show that my email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant. What should I do?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If your utility tool results showed that your email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant, you should request your email service provider’s technical team to comply with the DMARC policies set by email senders. If your service provider is unable to do that, we recommend that you switch to a DMARC-compliant provider so that you will not be vulnerable to email spoofing.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I start investing my CPF Ordinary Account (OA) savings in Treasury bills (T-bills) under CPF Investment Scheme-Ordinary Account (CPFIS-OA)?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You need to be at least 18 years old; not an undischarged bankrupt; and have more than $20,000 in your CPF Ordinary Account (OA). If you meet all of the conditions and would like to start investing your CPF OA savings in T-bills, please take the following steps:   Step 1: Complete CPFIS Self-Awareness Questionnaire (SAQ) to assess if CPFIS is suitable for you. You can check your SAQ completion status .   Step 2: Open CPF Investment Account (CPFIA) online with any of the three CPFIS agent banks: DBS's digibot (scroll to “Get started with CPFIA” and click “digibot”) OCBC's website   or OCBC's mobile app UOB's website Alternatively, you may also visit any of the banks (DBS, OCBC or UOB) branches to open your CPF Investment Account.   Step 3:  Invest in the T-bills of your choice. The Government issues 6-months and 1-year T-bills. You can check the MAS website on upcoming T-bills auctions. After deciding, you can use the bank’s online services to apply for T-bills. Refer to How to use your CPF for T-bills .   Step 4: Wait for the results of your T-bills purchase, which will be available on auction date. The bank will notify you on the outcome of your T-bills purchase. You can also check the T-bills allotted to you via your CPF Investment Account (CPFIA) online. Your CPF OA would be deducted and transferred to your CPFIA only upon successful allotment of the T-bills. The deducted amount (i.e., initial investment amount) would be lower than the amount which you have been allotted as T-bills are issued at a discount to the face value. Refer to the  T-bills FAQs on the MAS website on how to compute your initial investment amount based on cut-off yield (T-bills FAQs > Application of T-bills > “How do I compute my initial investment for my T-bills based on the cut-off yield?”).   Step 5: Upon maturity of your T-bills in 6 or 12 months (depending on the type of T-bills that you have purchased), your CPFIS agent bank will credit the proceeds to your IA. You can then take any of the following actions:   Re-invest in another T-bill purchase or any other investment. If you do not plan to re-invest your CPF OA savings, you can apply to return the balances in the CPFIA to CPF OA to earn the CPF interest. You can do so via your CPFIS agent bank’s ATMs, internet/phone banking or over the bank counter. Click  DBS and OCBC ’s links to find out more. If you do nothing, the monies in your CPFIA will be automatically returned to your CPF OA, if your CPFIA is inactive for 2 consecutive months.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I know whether the emails I receive are genuinely sent by CPF Board?
Knowledge Article: Answer: To ensure that an email is genuinely sent by the CPF Board, remember to always check that the sender’s email address ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I verify that my email domain is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant after switching email provider, or after my current email provider's technical team has implemented the needed protections?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can use the utility tool to test if your email address is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant. You can find CPF Board’s email receiver checker utility tool under Tools and services > Enquiry services.

Knowledge Article: Question: How long does it take to process applications relating to Healthcare?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Please refer to the table below for the processing time of our various Healthcare services.   Service Normal Processing Time Top up or voluntary contribution to MediSave Account (to pay MediShield Life Premiums) PayNow QR : Generally processed almost instantly Please note that payment via eNETS Debit is discontinued from 23 April 2023.   Find out more . Change your Payer for MediShield Life Cover  Online: Within three working days Stop Premium Payment for your Dependant(s)' MediShield Life Cover  Make A Health Declaration for new Permanent Residents Applicant Online : Within seven working days Make A MediSave Claim Online : Within three working days from the day we receive the claim from the medical institution Make A MediShield Life Claim Online : Within seven working days from the day we receive the claim from the medical institution/insurer Apply for MediSave/MediShield Life Reimbursement from Employers/Insurers Online: Within five working days Top Up My/My Loved Ones’ MediSave Account using CPF Online : Immediate

Knowledge Article: Question: My employee has resigned, and I have to top up the CPF contributions on Additional Wages (AW) after re-computing the AW ceiling. However, I am unable to recover the employee's share of CPF contributions from his wages. What should I do?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may apply to waive the employee's share of contributions if you meet the following conditions:   Deducted but unable to recover the employee's share of contributions in full or in part from the wages of employee’s last month of employment; and Made attempts but failed to recover the employee’s share from the employee; and Have applied estimated AW ceiling in the earlier months; You may write to us to submit your application with the following information: Employee’s last month of employment. Details of employee’s Ordinary Wage (OW), Additional Wage (AW) and employee’s share of contributions deducted for the year in this format . Correspondence with the employee as proof that you have made attempts but failed to recover the employee’s share of contributions from the employee. You are still required to pay the employer’s share of contributions and the waiver request is subject to the Board’s approval.

Knowledge Article: Question: I have received a notification on topping up my and/or my loved ones' retirement savings. How do I know that this notification is indeed sent by CPF Board?
Knowledge Article: Answer: To ensure that the notifications you received is sent by CPF Board, you should do the following checks:   Confirm that the sender's email address is correctly spelt and ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg. Verify that the sender's ID for SMS is correctly displayed as "gov.sg". The SMS will also begin with "Central Provident Fund Board". Ensure that the domain links in the notification end with "cpf.gov.sg", which directs you to the official CPF website. Examine the content of the notifications for any indications of phishing, such as urgent language, threats or requests for personal information. If you are unsure about the legitimacy of the notification, do not provide any personal information or click on any links. The Board will only send digital notifications to the email address registered in our records. You may verify or update your contact details in CPF Account settings with your Singpass.   If you receive any suspicious calls or digital notifications that seem to be spoofing the CPF Board, please report them to us via our CPF official hotline or Writetous .   Additionally, you can refer to resources provided by CPF Board for more information on how to avoid falling prey to phishing scams and how to protect yourself from phishing links .

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I claim the deceased member's discounted Singtel shares if he had not made a nomination or if he passed away before 1 January 1996?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If the deceased member had not made a nomination or if he passed away before 1 January 1996, we will transfer the discounted Singtel shares to his securities account or the estate securities account opened by his appointed executor(s) or administrator(s). If there is no securities account or estate securities account, the appointed executor(s) or administrator(s) may instruct the Board to sell the Singtel shares.   If no executor/administrator* is appointed for the estate of the deceased member, a representative of the deceased member's family or a proper claimant may instruct CPF Board to sell the shares and claim the sales proceeds or any dividends in cash. The following documents have to be submitted:   Indemnity Agreement with declaration that the deceased member has no will, and no Grant of Probate or Letter of Administration has been issued for his estate Letter of Consent from all immediate family members** of the deceased member Proof of relationship to the deceased member, e.g. marriage certificate, birth certificate Read more on the documents required .   *For small estates (below $50,000), the deceased member's family has the option of approaching the Public Trustee to administer the shares together with the estate of the deceased member.   **For Muslim members, all beneficiaries under the Islamic inheritance laws would have to complete the Letter of Consent.

Knowledge Article: Question: What if self-employed persons do not respond to the Notice of Computation (NOC)?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If self-employed persons (SEPs) do not respond to the NOC, the CPF Board may issue them a Letter of Demand and Offer which requires them to pay up their outstanding MediSave contributions, together with the payment of the composition amount offered. If there is still no payment, the Board may issue them a Notice to Attend Court (NTA). A sample is appended.   NTA for offences before 31 Dec 2021 (PDF, 0.1MB) NTA for offences on or after 31 Dec 2021 (PDF, 0.1MB) SEPs who are brought to court may face a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment of up to 6 months or both for first time offenders, and up to $10,000 or imprisonment of up to 12 months or both for subsequent offences.

Knowledge Article: Question: What is the minimum monthly payout I have to receive from my pension/annuity to withdraw all my retirement savings?
Knowledge Article: Answer: The minimum monthly payout you have to meet for you to withdraw all your retirement savings depends on your birth date and sex. This is computed with reference to the monthly payouts you can receive under CPF LIFE Standard plan with your Full Retirement Sum .   If your pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the minimum monthly payout, you can withdraw a partial amount of your retirement savings.

Knowledge Article: Question: How much can I withdraw if my pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the minimum monthly payout?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If your pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the  minimum monthly payout , you will be able to withdraw a partial amount of your retirement savings.   Your remaining retirement savings will be streamed out as monthly payouts to complement the monthly payouts you receive from your pension/annuity.

Knowledge Article: Question: Do I need to update my registered bank account to PayNow NRIC-linked bank account every time I want to make a withdrawal?
Knowledge Article: Answer: No, you only need to perform the update of your registered bank account to your PayNow NRIC-linked bank account  once  and wait 12 hours for it to be activated. You can do so via  Account settings . Thereafter, you may apply for retirement withdrawals for immediate needs via PayNow anytime to receive your CPF withdrawals almost instantly.

Knowledge Article: Question: What happens if I surrender my pension/annuity after I have withdrawn my savings?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you surrender your pension/annuity after you have withdrawn your retirement savings, the surrender value of your pension/annuity, up to your Full Retirement Sum with accrued interest, will be refunded to your Retirement Account. Any excess amount will be refunded to you in cash.   It's important to note that you will not be able to use your annuity to obtain a loan. This is because we need to ensure that we can refund the surrender value when you surrender your annuity.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why can't I withdraw my top-ups from my retirement savings if I have an alternative pension/annuity?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Top-ups to your retirement savings are meant to build up your retirement savings and boost your retirement payouts. Hence, they cannot be withdrawn as cash in a lump sum or used for other purposes.   In addition to earning risk-free interest rates on your top-ups, you might have also benefited from tax relief. Allowing withdrawals of the top-ups would defeat the purpose of the scheme and the incentives given.

Knowledge Article: Question: If I have a pension or annuity, can I withdraw my retirement savings?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can withdraw your retirement savings if you have a pension or annuity that provides you with monthly payouts for life. The amount of retirement savings you can withdraw will depend on the monthly payout you receive from your pension/annuity .   Generally, only pensions under the Singapore Government will be considered. As for annuities, only those bought using cash or under the CPF Investment Scheme will be considered. The annuities must also be administered by Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)-registered insurance companies and satisfy the requirements under the Insurance Act. Additionally, you must be the policyholder and sole insured person of the annuity policy.   Investment instruments such as endowments and bonds are not allowed as they generally do not provide the policyholder with a lifelong income.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I top up to myself, my children or my loved ones' CPF accounts?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can make a top up via Top up CPF accounts using PayNow QR 1 .   You will be prompted to key in your Recipient's NRIC/CPF Account Number if you are making a top-up on another person’s behalf.   All applications and payments should reach CPF Board by the last day of the calendar year for it to be counted as the year’s CPF Annual Limit. Backdating of top-ups to previous years is not allowed.   Tax relief is only applicable to self-employed persons, based on their assessable net trade income for the year of assessment.  Find out more about tax relief for self-employed persons .   You can find out more on which voluntary top-up is applicable to you.   To make cash top-ups to yourself or a loved one on another person’s behalf, you are required to be up-to-date with your MediSave payable (paid in full or on an active GIRO plan) under the Self-Employed Scheme . You may make payment for your MediSave payable via the payment modes .     Self-employed persons who meet the eligibility criteria will continue to enjoy self-employed tax relief. However, the contributions allocated to your MediSave account will no longer be used to offset your MediSave payable (if any).   1 Subsequent or duplicate payments made using the same PayNow QR code will be refunded. To ensure that your cash top-ups are processed successfully, please only scan the PayNow QR code and make payment once. You will need to submit a new application each time you wish to make another top-up.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I respond to CPF Board's reply if I have further clarification?
Knowledge Article: Answer: For further clarification on a case we have responded to you, you can use the enclosed unique link in our reply. This unique link is assigned to your case and should not be shared with others. You can submit a new enquiry at Contact Us .

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I view my past correspondences with CPF Board in "My Mailbox"?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can retrieve a copy of your correspondences between January and June 2024 via “Mailbox”. Find out how you can access Mailbox .  We have migrated to a new platform, correspondences before January 2024 have been archived.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I save a copy of the correspondence from "Mailbox"?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can download or print a copy of your message in “Mailbox” using the printer icon located at the top-right hand corner.

Knowledge Article: Question: My contact information populated in the “Write to us” form was incomplete/outdated. How can I make changes to it?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Find out how to update your contact information with the Board .  Please note that your updated contact details will only be reflected in the “Write to us” form after the change has taken effect.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I write to CPF Board securely?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can submit CPF account-specific enquiries via Contact us using your Singpass. To protect the confidentiality of your information, we will only send account-specific information to your registered contact details (i.e. email address, mobile number). Find out how to update your contact information with the Board .

Knowledge Article: Question: What does the CPF logo represent?
Knowledge Article: Answer: About the CPF Logo   The circle emphasises the completeness of the CPF system as a national social security savings scheme. The shield represents security and protection for our members in their retirement. The three keys represent the unity of the tripartite relationship among Employees, Employers and the Government. Lastly, the use of the colour green in our logo highlights the need for CPF's constant growth and dynamism.

Knowledge Article: Question: What are the types of wrongful practices?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Examples of wrongful practices include, but not limited to the following: Violation of CPFV’s code of ethics (PDF, 0.1MB) , Fraud or deliberately providing false or incorrect information, Violation of intellectual property rights, Financial and non-financial malpractices

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is there an error message stating that my MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you received an error message stating that your MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, it could be because your MediSave balance has been reserved for upcoming premium payments for yourself and/or your dependants' healthcare insurance coverage.   If you do not have enough MediSave balance to take over paying another insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, you may  top up your MediSave balance or arrange for another family member to take over the insured's premiums. This will ensure that you have sufficient MediSave balance reserved for your own healthcare needs.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is there an error message stating that my MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you received an error message stating that your MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, it could be because your MediSave balance has been reserved for upcoming premium payments for yourself and/or your dependants' healthcare insurance coverage.   If you do not have enough MediSave balance to take over paying another insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, you may  top up your MediSave balance or arrange for another family member to take over the insured's premiums. This will ensure that you have sufficient MediSave balance reserved for your own healthcare needs.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is there an error message stating that my MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you received an error message stating that your MediSave balance is insufficient to take over paying an insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, it could be because your MediSave balance has been reserved for upcoming premium payments for yourself and/or your dependants' healthcare insurance coverage.   If you do not have enough MediSave balance to take over paying another insured's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, you may  top up your MediSave balance or arrange for another family member to take over the insured's premiums. This will ensure that you have sufficient MediSave balance reserved for your own healthcare needs.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I view and pay my/my dependant(s)'s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can log in to your Healthcare dashboard to view your or your dependant(s)’s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life coverage and premium information under the “Long-term care insurance” and “Health insurance” section respectively.   Paying your premiums Premiums are fully payable by MediSave. If you do not have sufficient MediSave, you can pay the premiums by:   1) Performing a voluntary top-up to your MediSave Account via the Top up MediSave Account  online form.    MediSave top-ups are generally credited within 3 working days and will be automatically deducted for premium payment(s). You may view the MediSave top-up(s) and premium deduction(s) in your Transaction history at cpf.gov.sg .   As MediSave top-ups could be deducted for healthcare premiums and medical expenses based on when deductions are due, please ensure that you have sufficient MediSave for all payments.   2) Asking a family member to perform a Change Payer request to take over the premium payment using his/her MediSave.   More payment options are available in the link below:   I have renounced my citizenship/am residing overseas with no local bank account. How do I pay my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I view and pay my/my dependant(s)'s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life premiums?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can log in to your Healthcare dashboard to view your or your dependant(s)’s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life coverage and premium information under the “Long-term care insurance” and “Health insurance” section respectively.   Paying your premiums Premiums are fully payable by MediSave. If you do not have sufficient MediSave, you can pay the premiums by:   1) Performing a voluntary top-up to your MediSave Account via the Top up MediSave Account  online form.    MediSave top-ups are generally credited within 3 working days and will be automatically deducted for premium payment(s). You may view the MediSave top-up(s) and premium deduction(s) in your Transaction history at cpf.gov.sg .   As MediSave top-ups could be deducted for healthcare premiums and medical expenses based on when deductions are due, please ensure that you have sufficient MediSave for all payments.   2) Asking a family member to perform a Change Payer request to take over the premium payment using his/her MediSave.   More payment options are available in the link below:   I have renounced my citizenship/am residing overseas with no local bank account. How do I pay my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is there an error message stating that I am not paying for my family member's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life coverage when I tried to stop premium payment?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you encountered an error message stating that you are not paying your family member's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, it could be due to several reasons:   1. Not the Payer: The error may arise if you are not the payer for your family member's healthcare insurance.   2. Coverage Under Integrated Shield Plan (IP) or Supplement Plan: If your family member has an Integrated Shield Plan or Supplement Plan, please contact the insured's private insurer directly for payer arrangements.   3. Inactive Coverage: Your family member's healthcare coverage is inactive.

Knowledge Article: Question: Why is there an error message stating that I am not paying for my family member's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life coverage when I tried to stop premium payment?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you encountered an error message stating that you are not paying your family member's CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums, it could be due to several reasons:   1. Not the Payer: The error may arise if you are not the payer for your family member's healthcare insurance.   2. Coverage Under Integrated Shield Plan (IP) or Supplement Plan: If your family member has an Integrated Shield Plan or Supplement Plan, please contact the insured's private insurer directly for payer arrangements.   3. Inactive Coverage: Your family member's healthcare coverage is inactive.

Knowledge Article: Question: I have outstanding MediSave payable. Why am I not able to make voluntary top-ups to my or my loved ones' MediSave Account?
Knowledge Article: Answer: As a self-employed person, you are required to be up-to-date with your MediSave payable (paid in full or on an active GIRO plan) when making top ups to your MediSave Account or your loved ones'.   You can conveniently request for an instalment plan or make full payment for your MediSave payable via the  Manage your MediSave payable  form. You will be able to make voluntary top-ups when you are up-to-date with your MediSave payable.   Conversely, you will be able to receive voluntary top-ups from your loved ones if they are up-to-date with their MediSave payable (if applicable).

Knowledge Article: Question: I have outstanding MediSave payable. Why am I not able to make voluntary top-ups to my CPF accounts or on another person's behalf?
Knowledge Article: Answer: As a self-employed person, you are required to be up-to-date with your MediSave payable (paid in full or on an active GIRO plan) when making top ups to your CPF accounts or on another person’s behalf.   You can conveniently request for an instalment plan or make full payment for your MediSave payable via the  Manage your MediSave payable  form. You will be able to make voluntary top-ups when you are up-to-date with your MediSave payable.   Conversely, you will be able to receive voluntary top-ups from your loved ones if they are up-to-date with their MediSave payable (if applicable).

Knowledge Article: Question: Why does CPF Board not start my payouts automatically at 65?
Knowledge Article: Answer: We understand that every member has unique retirement goals and needs. That is why we do not assume that everyone wants to start their payouts at 65.   Your CPF savings earn risk-free interest rates* of up to 6% per annum , which means the longer you wait to start your payouts, the more your retirement savings will grow. This increase in savings will result in higher monthly payouts under CPF LIFE.   Starting payouts automatically at 65 means denying members this option.   That is why we always encourage our members to instruct us when they want to start their payouts, as they would be the best judge of their own circumstances.   Here's an interesting fact: For every year that you defer your CPF LIFE payouts, your monthly payout amount increases by up to 7%. This means that if you defer for 5 years, your monthly payout could increase by up to 35%. Hence, weigh your options and make the decision that is best for you and your retirement goals.   * Based on the current 4% interest rate floor on Special and Retirement Account monies.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I check the amount of matching grant that I will receive?
Knowledge Article: Answer: To find out the grant amount that you will receive in the beginning of the next year on the cash top-ups which you had received, you can log in to your  Retirement Dashboard . The Dashboard will provide you with the additional grant amount, if any, which you can receive if you make further top-ups.

Knowledge Article: Question: How does the closure of my Special Account affect my retirement payouts?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you are receiving monthly payouts, your payouts will increase if some or all of your Special Account (SA) savings are transferred to your Retirement Account (RA) when your SA is closed . You will be notified to check your monthly payouts after the transfer and closure of your SA in early 2025.   You can also transfer your Ordinary Account savings to your RA, up to the prevailing Enhanced Retirement Sum, to increase your monthly payouts.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am an undischarged bankrupt. Can I still choose to withdraw my Retirement Account savings using my property?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Whether you can withdraw your Retirement Account (RA) savings using your property depends on whether you own an HDB or private property.   For HDB property owners   You can choose to set aside your Full Retirement Sum (FRS) with a mixture of property (up to half your FRS) and cash, and withdraw part of your RA savings down to your Basic Retirement Sum (BRS*) if your HDB property can last you until 95.   For private property owners   You can choose to set aside your FRS with a mixture of property (up to half your FRS) and cash, and withdraw part of your RA savings down to your BRS* if your private property can last you until 95 and the expected housing refund  is enough to restore your Full Retirement Sum (FRS).   However, if you have not used your CPF savings for your property, or the expected housing refund is not enough to restore your FRS, you will not be able to withdraw your RA savings. This is because no additional charge can be created on your property. If you need more information, you can approach the Official Assignee.   It is important to note that the amount of RA savings you can withdraw excludes interest earned, any government grants received and top-ups to your retirement savings . It also depends on your RA balance at the point of withdrawal. For example, if you are on CPF LIFE and have started your monthly payouts, any new inflows received in your RA will be used to increase your CPF LIFE premium to provide you with higher monthly payouts, and you will not be allowed to withdraw them in a lump sum.   * Excluding interest, any government grants and top-ups made under the Retirement Sum Topping-Up Scheme.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am not a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident. I have recently checked my CPF account and noticed that my CPF balance is $0. Why is this so, as I have yet to withdraw my CPF monies?
Knowledge Article: Answer: As you are no longer a Singapore Citizen / Permanent Resident, your CPF account has been  automatically closed in the month following your renunciation. Any remaining CPF savings have been transferred out of your CPF account into the General Moneys of the Fund (GMF)* and stopped earning the prevailing CPF interest.   As a concession, the savings will earn interest similar to commercial bank interest rates until 31 March 2027. You are encouraged to transfer your savings to your bank account as soon as possible.   To transfer your CPF savings to your bank account, please refer to the  steps , under “Take Action”.   * The GMF is an account where CPF Board holds unclaimed monies on behalf of CPF members, nominees or beneficiaries.

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I update my subscription preferences for my CPF notifications?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can update your subscription preferences via the Account settings page with your Singpass. Once you have logged in with Singpass, click on the “Subscription” tab. You can choose to receive notifications on CPF educational content and events, as well as alerts on your CPF contributions, by clicking on the respective check boxes.   You can unsubscribe from such notifications anytime. Even if you unsubscribe from receiving educational content, please rest assured that you will still receive key notifications on CPF transactions and policies through your registered contact details.

Knowledge Article: Question: What is "My dashboards" and what is available in "My dashboards"?
Knowledge Article: Answer: “My dashboards” are pages that summarise your personalised CPF information and the relevant digital services that will help you to make informed decisions.   Please login to the following my cpf digital services – My dashboards with your Singpass and 2-Factor Authentication (2FA) to access the information.   Retirement Home ownership Healthcare Providing for your loved ones Investment Child Self-employment

Knowledge Article: Question: What happens to my CPF savings if I have unpaid taxes, MediShield Life premiums, CareShield Life premiums or outstanding education loan owed to a CPF member when my account is closed?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you have  unpaid tax/MediShield Life premiums/CareShield Life premiums/outstanding education loan owed to a CPF member,  we may recover the unpaid amount from your CPF savings when your CPF account is closed.   You are encouraged to settle any outstanding liabilities (e.g. insurance, tax and housing liabilities) before your CPF account is closed.

Knowledge Article: Question: I am the appointed donee/deputy for my next-of-kin. How can I apply to withdraw his CPF savings under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: As an appointed donee or deputy under the Mental Capacity Act for your next-of-kin, you may apply to withdraw your next-of-kin’s CPF savings under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme by completing this form with a copy of your NRIC attached. This form also allows you to concurrently apply for both Home Protection Scheme (HPS) and Dependants’ Protection Scheme (DPS) benefits.   Please provide the following original documents to us:   1. Medical report from an  accredited doctor stating that the member lacks mental capacity permanently; 2. Lasting Power of Attorney or Court Order; and 3. Trust bank account statement or passbook.   You can make an appointment to visit any of our CPF Service Centres to submit the above original documents or mail the original documents to us at:   CPF Board Retirement Withdrawals Department Robinson Road P.O. Box 3060 Singapore 905060

Knowledge Article: Question: How long does it take to process the application for withdrawal under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Please refer to the table for our service standards for processing withdrawal under Reduced Life Expectancy:   Service Normal processing time Withdraw under Reduced Life Expectancy scheme We will update the status of your application generally within fourteen working days after we have received both your application and the completed medical certification form from your doctor.   After your application is approved, you will generally receive your CPF savings within the next three working days.

Knowledge Article: Question: What if my next-of-kin did not make a Lasting Power of Attorney?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can apply to the court to be appointed as the member's Deputy under the Mental Capacity Act if your next-of-kin did not make a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) and has lost his mental capacity to make decisions. As a guide, you may wish to include the  suggested clauses in the court order if you want to be empowered to manage all of the member's CPF matters.   The Family Justice Courts has also introduced a simplified application process for specific categories of applications. This process generally restricts the use of monies to $60,000 and below. For more information, please visit the  Family Justice Courts website .   To give the family time to apply for the court order, the member's caregiver may approach CPF Board to withdraw up to $10,000 of the member's CPF savings for the costs of the member's maintenance.

Knowledge Article: Question: If I am eligible to receive monthly payouts under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme, when will the monthly payouts be paid to me?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You will receive the monthly payouts in your bank account generally on the 2nd or 3rd day of each month, if your bank supports Fast And Secure Transfer (FAST).   Otherwise, you will receive your payouts later, via Inter-bank GIRO (IBG).

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I check the status of my application under the Reduced Life Expectancy Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: To check the status of your application under the Reduced Life Expectancy Scheme, you can login to CPF website, click on ‘ my CPF’ , followed by ‘ Activities ’.

Knowledge Article: Question: I have a medical condition resulting in reduced life expectancy. How do I apply to withdraw my CPF savings? Can I claim insurance benefits under the Home Protection Scheme and Dependants Protection Scheme at the same time?
Knowledge Article: Answer: For member's convenience, CPF Board has developed a one-stop application form for you to withdraw your CPF savings and apply for Home Protection Scheme (HPS) and Dependants Protection Scheme (DPS) benefits, if applicable.   To do so, you will need to:   Submit an  online application after logging in via Singpass. The application form will allow you to concurrently apply for both Home Protection Scheme (HPS) and  Dependants Protection Scheme (DPS)  benefits if applicable. Download the medical certification form that is provided upon submission of the online application and have it completed by an  accredited doctor . The medical institution will need to submit the completed medical certification to CPF Board within 90 days of your application. Otherwise, your application will be cancelled. If you are also claiming HPS benefits, you are required to inform your employer to submit your employment information to CPF Board. The employment information will allow us to accurately determine your claim event date and amount of claim benefits. A FormSG link will be provided to you upon submission of the online application. Please provide the link to your employer for completion. Your employer would require a Corppass to login.   After CPF Board receives the completed medical certification and employment information (for HPS claim, if required), you will receive an email or SMS notifying you that the application is in progress. You will be required to register or update your contact details under Account settings before proceeding with the online application so that you will receive the necessary notifications. CPF Board will notify you on the outcome of your withdrawal application. For DPS, Great Eastern Life will notify you separately on the outcome of your claims.   If the medical certification is to be completed by a doctor from an overseas medical institution, please write to us for assistance.   If you are mailing your documents from overseas, all documents (except for original documents) must be witnessed/certified true by an official of a Singapore Overseas Mission with his official seal/stamp duly affixed.   Alternatively, if you are residing in a country which is part of the Apostille Convention :   Your documents must first be witnessed and certified true by a Notary Public; Thereafter, the notarised documents must be certified by the designated Competent Authority of your country via the issuance of an apostille certificate.

Knowledge Article: Question: When do I need to submit the documents to support my application for withdrawal under the Reduced Life Expectancy Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: After you have submitted your application, the completed medical certification form for withdrawal under the Reduced Life Expectancy Scheme must be submitted by your doctor to CPF Board within 90 days of your application.   If you have also applied to claim Home Protection Scheme benefits in the same application, your employer is also required to submit your employment information within 90 days of your application. The employment information will allow CPFB to accurately determine your claim event date and amount of claim benefits.   Please note that your application will be cancelled if we do not receive the supporting documents by the given deadline.

Knowledge Article: Question: What is net trade income?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Net trade income is your gross trade income minus all allowable business expenses, capital allowances and trade losses as determined by the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS).

Knowledge Article: Question: What is net trade income?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Net trade income is your gross trade income minus all allowable business expenses, capital allowances and trade losses as determined by the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS).

Knowledge Article: Question: Where can I find services for one-stop assistance on legacy planning?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can walk into the nearest ServiceSG Centres with your Singpass to make an online Nomination and a Lasting Power of Attorney application.  Officers at the ServiceSG Centres can act as witnesses when you complete an online Nomination form on CPF website and guide you through making a Lasting Power of Attorney. Please refer to the list of ServiceSG Centres and their operating hours:    Region  ServiceSG Centres Operating Hours North   ServiceSG@Bukit Canberra Bukit Canberra Integrated Sports & Community Hub #01-62 21 Canberra Link Singapore 756973 ServiceSG@Nee Soon Central Community Club Northpoint City (Near Berth B8 in Yishun Bus Interchange) #01-201 1 North Point Drive Singapore 768019 Mon - Sun: 10am to 6pm Closed on Public Holidays North-East  ServiceSG Centre One Punggol #01-01 1 Punggol Drive Singapore 828629 Mon - Sun: 9am to 6pm Closed on Public Holidays East ServiceSG Centre Our Tampines Hub #01-21 1 Tampines Walk Singapore 528523 ServiceSG@Kampong Chai Chee Community Club Heartbeat@Bedok #01-31 11 Bedok North Street 1 Singapore 469662 Mon - Sun: 9am to 6pm Closed on Public Holidays   Mon - Sun: 10am to 6pm Closed on Public Holidays West ServiceSG@The Frontier Community Club The Frontier Community Place #01-01 60 Jurong West Central 3 Singapore 648346 ServiceSG@Keat Hong Community Club #01-01 2 Choa Chu Kang Loop Singapore 689687 Mon - Sun: 10am to 6pm Closed on Public Holidays

Knowledge Article: Question: How can I provide feedback on the event?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may scan the survey QR code at the end of the session to share your feedback or suggestions with us.

Knowledge Article: Question: When is the event registration deadline?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Event registration will close one day before the event date or when the event is fully subscribed, whichever comes first. You are strongly encouraged to register early to secure your seat.

Knowledge Article: Question: What do I need to bring to the physical event?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You will receive an email confirmation upon successful registration of the event. Please present the email confirmation to the event personnel in order to enter the event premises. If you are unable to find your email confirmation, please provide your name so that our event personnel can assist to verify your registration status.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I check the status of my application under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can check the status of your CPF Education Loan Scheme application under " Activities " by logging in to CPF website using your Singpass.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I check for the reasons if my application under the CPF Education Loan Scheme is rejected?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can check the reason for rejection of your CPF Education Loan Scheme application under " Activities " by logging in to CPF website with your Singpass.

Knowledge Article: Question: What does the status shown under "Activities" mean for online applications made under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may refer to the following table for the status and what it mean for online applications made under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.   Status displayed under “Activities”  What it means a) Action required The CPF lender has yet to endorse application. Please remind the CPF lender to endorse it. Applications not endorsed within 14 days from submission date will be automatically rejected. b) In progress The CPF lender has endorsed the application. Application is under processing, pending confirmation of your enrolment data from the institution. c) Completed Approved subject to available funds at deduction. Deductions from the CPF lender’s Ordinary Account will be made to the institution upon claim by the institution. A notification will be sent to the lender generally by the following month after the deductions are made. d) Not successful Your application has been rejected. e) Cancelled Cancelled as requested.

Knowledge Article: Question: What if we do not have a Singpass to submit our online application under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may apply for a Singpass online. After obtaining your Singpass, you may complete and submit an online application via “ Apply for CPF education loan ” under "Forms and e-applications", within the  application period .

Knowledge Article: Question: What happens to my online CPF Education Loan application that have been endorsed by the CPF member?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If the application is successful, you will be notified on the application status generally within the next two months after the conditions have been met. You can check the application status under " Activities " by logging in to CPF website with your Singpass.   For all unsuccessful/ invalid applications, it could be due to one of the following reasons:  Did not meet the eligibility criteria i.e CPF member does not have sufficient Ordinary Account savings up to the Available Withdrawal Limit for education purposes. Application was not endorsed by member within the deadline of 14 days. Duplicate application detected i.e it is a one-time application for the whole course of study. You may wish to consider the MOE Tuition Fee Loan that is interest-free during your course of study, if your application for the CPF Education Loan is unsuccessful.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I revoke the use of CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You must be the CPF lender (whose CPF savings is withdrawn) in order to apply to revoke the use of CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. You may submit your application online to revoke the use of CPF savings for education through " Forms and e-applications " using your Singpass. You will be informed through email notification on the status of the application if you have registered your email with the Board through Account services.

Knowledge Article: Question: What are the modes of repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: We recommend students to arrange for GIRO repayments, as it provides the utmost convenience. With automatic monthly deductions, students can ensure timely repayments as long as there are sufficient funds in their bank account.   Alternatively, students can make manual repayments either in a lump sum or monthly instalments. Both options can be accessed through the " Forms and e-applications " section on the CPF website.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I submit a request to start repaying the education loan earlier, instead of waiting one year from my graduation?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If you have graduated and wish to make an early repayment, you may either make your repayment via monthly instalments or lump sum repayment:   1. Monthly instalments - You have to inform us your intention to start early repayment of your education loan through ' Write to us '. Please state the month which you would like to start the repayment and we will advise you on the monthly instalment amount.   After your request for early repayment has been approved, we recommend that you set up GIRO for your education loan repayments through " Forms and e-applications " with your Singpass to deduct your monthly repayments through GIRO. You will be re-directed to the bank's ibanking portal to complete the application.   You can also download and submit the " Repay Education Loan Using GIRO (FORM EDN/GIRO) " (PDF, 0.4MB).   2. Lump sum repayment - You may proceed to make a partial or full lump sum repayment online through " Manage education loan repayments " under "Forms and e-applications".

Knowledge Article: Question: What happens if I default in my education repayment and has arrears?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You will receive monthly arrears notifications to inform you on your repayment in arrears. You may make payment for your arrears through " Manage education loan repayments " under "Forms and e-applications". If you are facing financial difficulties in repaying the arrears, you can write in to us to discuss on a suitable payment plan.

Knowledge Article: Question: What happens after I have endorsed the online CPF Education Loan application?
Knowledge Article: Answer: If your application is successful, the borrower will be notified on the application status generally within the next two months after the conditions have been met. He/she can check the application status under " Activities " by logging in to CPF website  with Singpass.   For all unsuccessful/ invalid applications, it could be due to one of the following reasons:    Did not meet the eligibility criteria i.e CPF lender does not have sufficient Ordinary Account savings up to the Available Withdrawal Limit for education purposes. Application was not endorsed by lender within the deadline of 14 days. Duplicate application detected i.e it is a one-time application for the whole course of study. The borrower may wish to consider the MOE Tuition Fee Loan which is interest-free during his/her course of study, if the application for the CPF Education Loan is unsuccessful.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I pay for my education arrears?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may make payment for your arrears through " Manage education loan repayments " under "Forms and e-applications". Please also check with your bank on your daily withdrawal limit and arrange with your bank to increase your withdrawal limit if needed.   If you are repaying your education loan by GIRO, please note that any arrears will not be deducted through GIRO and will have to be paid through "Manage education loan repayments" as mentioned above.   You can check if you have outstanding arrears by accessing your Education dashboard .   For more information on education loan arrears and repayment crediting sequence, please refer to these FAQs:   What are education loan arrears? Are there any penalties for non-payment of monthly instalments? Why do I still receive notifications from CPF Board regarding my education loan arrears even though I have made repayment via PayNow? What is the crediting sequence for my education loan repayments if I pay via PayNow?

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I make a repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You can refer to this FAQ on the different modes of repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. You may apply for GIRO online or by mail.   Online through " Forms and e-applications "  (highly recommended for quicker processing and for monthly instalments)   1. Log in with your Singpass. 2. Apply via “Set up GIRO for education loan repayments” in " Forms and e-applications ". *Check your GIRO application status under the ‘Activities’ section.   Mail Download and complete the FORM EDN/GIRO: Repay Education Loan Using GIRO (PDF, 0.4MB). Mail it to the address printed overleaf of the GIRO application form. Please note that making a partial lump sum repayment does not replace your regular monthly repayments. Therefore, ensure you make your regular monthly repayments at least three working days before the end of the month to allow for sufficient processing time.

Knowledge Article: Question: How do I change my monthly instalment for my education loan repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
Knowledge Article: Answer: You may submit your application online to change your monthly instalment through " Manage education loan repayments " under "Forms and e-applications" using your Singpass. The minimum monthly instalment is $100. You are encouraged to increase your monthly instalment as this will enable you to fully repay your education loan within a shorter period and hence minimise the interest that you have to pay.

Knowledge Article: Question: Can I reduce the monthly instalment for my CPF Education Loan stated in my repayment notification?
Knowledge Article: Answer: Reducing the monthly instalment amount will mean a longer repayment period thus incurring more interest on the loan.
